intro: Beilschmiedia pullenii, commonly known as the purple-leafed beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green to purple-colored leaves, which are often clustered at the base of the stems. Beilschmiedia pullenii typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its small, fragrant flowers are followed by oval-shaped berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
